timeline.bodyText: When we will try to add new nodes in addNewDockerNodesOn(), wont this lead to us only considering the node on the first host that we read from ZK (or whatever order the hosts in allNodes are)?
timeline.author: freva

replies.bodyText: How? Each node added is checked against all the (parents of) candidates already added.
replies.author: mpolden

replies.bodyText:
Lets say we need to allocate 1 node, we have 2 hosts: a and b. b has massive skew, so allocation to a should be preferred. Both a and b are on the same switch, s.
Since we need to allocate 1 node, we start by creating a virtual reserved node on both a and b: a1 and b1, as we create them, we check if nodes already has a node on s (initially, that is not the case). After we add the first of a1 and b1, the second one will be deemed as not on exclusive switch, so skew is completely ignored.
replies.author: freva

replies.bodyText: So given two hosts on the same switch, you want to prefer the candidate on the host with the least skew?
replies.author: mpolden

replies.bodyText: The point is that while a1 and b1 are on the same switch, only 1 of them will be actually allocated anyway, so they cant be in conflict with each other
replies.author: freva

replies.bodyText:
only 1 of them will be actually allocated anyway

The exclusive switch isn't a hard requirement though. If you ask for 2 nodes, you will allocate both a1 and b1 if no better candidate on an exclusive switch exists.
replies.author: mpolden

timeline.bodyText: All the nodes should be on the same cluster, but they aren't because we add all application nodes (addApplicationNodes()) instead of just adding cluster nodes. I think we should fix addApplicationNodes() to just add cluster nodes (they are immediately just dropped in NodeAllocation::offer anyway) and then we wont need this class, just group by switchHostname.
